text: Is there an implementation for Rician distributions in Julia? Distributions.jl doesn't seem to have it, and a quick Google search didn't yield one

elements.text: Is there an implementation for Rician distributions in Julia? Distributions.jl doesn't seem to have it, and a quick Google search didn't yield one

text: I didn't find any either, and ended up just writing the cdf formula from wiki - that's all I needed

elements.text: I didn't find any either, and ended up just writing the cdf formula from wiki - that's all I needed

text: Thanks. I just coded up pretty much the entire `Distributions.jl` interface for Rician. I’ll make a package with it, so others can use it if they need it.

elements.text: Thanks. I just coded up pretty much the entire
interface for Rician. I’ll make a package with it, so others can use it if they need it.

text: <@UGTUKUHLN> How did you implement the cdf, since it involves an infinite sum or an integral? My current implementation is based on numerical integration of the pdf. Wondering if there’s a more efficient way.

elements.text: How did you implement the cdf, since it involves an infinite sum or an integral? My current implementation is based on numerical integration of the pdf. Wondering if there’s a more efficient way.

text: Yes, I used QuadGK for integration

elements.text: Yes, I used QuadGK for integration

text: Pretty much the same then, thanks!

elements.text: Pretty much the same then, thanks!

text: I think it would be great to have your implementation in Distributions itself, as you wrote its interface functions as well

elements.text: I think it would be great to have your implementation in Distributions itself, as you wrote its interface functions as well

text: OK, I’ll attempt a PR then :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: OK, I’ll attempt a PR then

text:
Turns out they even have the rice distribution in the "wanted" list - <https://github.com/JuliaStats/Distributions.jl/issues/124>
I'm sure such a PR will be welcome
